meanings.definition: propitiators: those who make peace or reconcile with someone
meanings.sent1: The propitiators helped the two friends resolve their argument peacefully.
meanings.sent2: The propitiators in the community always strive to mend relationships.
meanings.sent3: The propitiators organized a fun game night to bring harmony back to the group.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words acted as propitiators, soothing the tension between the siblings.
meanings.sent5: The propitiators' efforts were like gentle waves calming the storm of disagreement.

meanings.definition: propitiators: objects or actions that appease or satisfy a deity or spirit
meanings.sent1: The villagers offered fruits and flowers as propitiators to the river god.
meanings.sent2: Burning incense sticks is a common practice as propitiators in many cultures.
meanings.sent3: The propitiators of the ancient ritual included chanting and dancing under the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: The sacred drumbeats served as propitiators, invoking the spirits of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The colorful tapestries were used as propitiators to honor the spirits of nature.
